repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - State Highway Management Project
            (Alagoas and Santa Catarina States)

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            and, sustainability, though likely in Santa Catarina, seems
            however, uncertain in Alagoas. The lessons indicate how an
            optimized network rehabilitation, and maintenance strategy,
            can effectively re-instate an entire road network into
            satisfactory conditions, over a period of just a few years,
            and at reasonable costs, as demonstrated in Santa Catarina.
            It is suggested that a proactive supervision, and project
            restructuring, if critical assumptions have changed (the
            funding capacities of the states were converted following
            the establishment of the stabilization program), are
            essential ingredients to achieve development objectives. The
            increase of the Bank's cost-share for civil works, from
            50 percent to 75 percent, drastically improved the
            attractiveness of the loans, hence, consideration for
            offering better cost-sharing arrangements, should be taken
            into account. While grouping similar sub-projects under one
            "umbrella" project can lead to savings at the
            project processing stage, the very few economies of scale in
            supervision, renders appraisal, and completion stages so
            difficult, that it is therefore suggested that each
            sub-project be adequately, and separately funded, to allow
            for effective supervision, and include civil works'
            field visits as well.

abstracts.cdata!:
The project will help to check the
            deterioration of the state road networks and improve their
            condition. The project consists of two similar subprojects
            in the borrower states. Each subproject will include: (a) a
            policy and institutional development program to: (i) prepare
            and annually update the state's pluriannual and annual
            road expenditure and funding programs, consistent with
            agreed priorities and targets; (ii) develop and implement a
            pavement management system to help prepare and monitor
            appropriate road rehabilitation and maintenance strategies
            and programs; (iii) strengthen the State Roads
            Department's (DER's) contract and project
            management systems; and (iv) develop appropriate capability
            in the DER and in the state government to implement and
            monitor environmental standards and guidelines for state
            roads; and (b) an investment and maintenance program
            consisting of the rehabilitation, resurfacing and routine
            maintenance components of the state's 1992-96 road
            program. The two subprojects combined will include about 950
            km of rehabilitation and 1,400 km of resurfacing works. The
            project will help to check the deterioration of the state
            road networks and improve their condition. The project
            consists of two similar subprojects in the borrower states.
            Each subproject will include: (a) a policy and institutional
            development program to: (i) prepare and annually update the
            state's pluriannual and annual road expenditure and
            funding programs, consistent with agreed priorities and
            targets; (ii) develop and implement a pavement management
            system to help prepare and monitor appropriate road
            rehabilitation and maintenance strategies and programs;
            (iii) strengthen the State Roads Department's
            (DER's) contract and project management systems; and
            (iv) develop appropriate capability in the DER and in the
            state government to implement and monitor environmental
            standards and guidelines for state roads; and (b) an
            investment and maintenance program consisting of the
            rehabilitation, resurfacing and routine maintenance
            components of the state's 1992-96 road program. The two
            subprojects combined will include about 950 km of
            rehabilitation and 1,400 km of resurfacing works.
